intro: Psilocaulon stenopetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled psilocaulon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences.
